roleset.name: cause a (small) increase in, strengthen

example.name: transitive active
example.text: In addition to those measures, the company spent heavily earlier this year to install displays at its customers' retail outlets -- a strategy that Mr. Stein said *trace* has helped bolster awareness of the company's brands.

example.name: transitive passive
example.text: London share prices were bolstered largely by continued gains on Wall Street and technical factors affecting demand for London's blue-chip stocks.
example.arg: by continued gains on Wall Street and technical factors affecting demand for London's blue-chip stocks.

example.name: with quantification
example.text: The company also said the transaction would bolster after-tax earnings by $3.25 a share when completed.

roleset.note: BOLSTER-V NOTES: This verb might also show start and end points like 'rise' etc, but Idoubt it. If they do appear, refer to 'rise' for proper arg numbering. (from bolster.01-v)
